channel.title: playerGfx method. #3
channel.description:
Still, i haven't had an answer for this. And i'm not giving up. Over the past few days, i've been wondering why this isn't working. Making new methods to see if i can improve it. And still, nothing.. Looking into the stillGfx method, see if i have anything missing, anything that needs to be changed etc..
As you know, ricscape, or rickscape, is a popular PK source. Based around level 1, varrock wild. It has now developed, to varrock?.. But, it still has the same features. I think it is now called Penguin scape, or something i'm not too sure of. There is also a server, that SWAT made. And i'd like to take his for an example.
The method he used.. ... (playerGfx) [code] public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) { mask100var1 = id; mask100var2 = delay; mask100update = true; updateRequired = true; } [/code]
That will make the GFX move with the player, correct?... So i kept on searching, and searching, and searching.. The only think i could find, with playerGfx, inside it, was when it was being called, into a method, like so.. [code] playerGfx(252, 0); [/code]
Dds special, gfx 252, delay of gfx? = 0..
Now, that works perfect, i've even added it to most spells, and it works 100%.
My problem:
On my source, when i add that method. No errors..
When i call it, same usage: [code] playerGfx(252, 0); [/code]
Into the Dds special method. It doesn't do the GFX..
It does everything else, emote, hit, special delay, timers, but no Gfx.. It works fine, when i use staticAnimation, or stillGfx.. But not with playerGfx..
I would use staticAnimation, but the special, always faces south when your spec'ing, and it looks rediculous lol.
Does anyone know how to fix this? If so, please post :). Thanks. [br][size=1]Posted on: October 27, 2007, 03:20:13 PM[/size][hr]Please, c'mon..

item.title: playerGfx method. #3
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Still, i haven’t had an answer for this. And i’m not giving up. Over the past few days, i’ve been wondering why this isn’t working. Making new methods to see if i can improve it. And still, nothing… Looking into the stillGfx method, see if i have anything missing, anything that needs to be changed etc…

As you know, ricscape, or rickscape, is a popular PK source. Based around level 1, varrock wild. It has now developed, to varrock?.. But, it still has the same features. I think it is now called Penguin scape, or something i’m not too sure of. There is also a server, that SWAT made. And i’d like to take his for an example.

The method he used… … (playerGfx)

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

That will make the GFX move with the player, correct?.. So i kept on searching, and searching, and searching… The only think i could find, with playerGfx, inside it, was when it was being called, into a method, like so…

playerGfx(252, 0);

Dds special, gfx 252, delay of gfx? = 0…

Now, that works perfect, i’ve even added it to most spells, and it works 100%.

My problem:

On my source, when i add that method. No errors…

When i call it, same usage:

playerGfx(252, 0);

Into the Dds special method. It doesn’t do the GFX…

It does everything else, emote, hit, special delay, timers, but no Gfx… It works fine, when i use staticAnimation, or stillGfx… But not with playerGfx…

I would use staticAnimation, but the special, always faces south when your spec’ing, and it looks rediculous lol.

Does anyone know how to fix this? If so, please post :). Thanks.
[br][size=1]Posted on: October 27, 2007, 03:20:13 PM[/size][hr]Please, c’mon…

Read full topic
